name: unzip
desc: unzip is a commonly used command line tool for decompressing compressed files. It can decompress various compression formats, including .zip, .tar, .gz, .bz2, .xz, etc.

-a.name: Preserve the text attributes of the file after decompression

-f.name: Specify the file to be decompressed

-l.name: Display the file list of the compressed file

-n.name: Do not overwrite existing files when decompressing

-o.name: Use the old file overwrite mode

-p.name: Retain the path information of the file

-q.name: Silent mode, do not display decompression process

-t.name: Test the integrity of the compressed file

-u.name: Only decompress files that are newer than the current file

-x.name: Unzip files to their extension directories

content:
Example

  1. Extract a .zip file:

    unzip file.zip

  2. Extract a .zip file to a specific directory:

    unzip file.zip -d destination_directory

  3. Extract a .zip file and overwrite existing files:

    unzip -o file.zip

  4. Extract a .zip file and display extraction progress:

    unzip -v file.zip

  5. Extract a .tar file:

    unzip file.tar

  6. Extract a .tar file to a specific directory:

    unzip file.tar -d destination_directory

  7. Extract a .tar.gz file:

    unzip file.tar.gz

  8. Extract a .tar.gz file to a specific directory:

    unzip file.tar.gz -d destination_directory
